citation.article-title: Dyella soli sp. nov. and Dyella terrae sp. nov., isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Dyella terrae sp. nov.
Dyella terrae (ter′rae. L. gen. n. terrae of the soil).
Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, rod-shaped, 0.4–0.5 μm wide and 1.0–5.0 μm long, and motile with one polar flagellum.
After growth on R2A medium at 28 °C for 2 days, colonies are yellow and irregular.
Grows well on R2A agar, nutrient agar, tryptic soy agar and MacConkey agar.
Positive for methyl red test and negative for nitrate reduction, Voges–Proskauer, H2S production and phenylalanine deaminase.
Grows at 10–35 °C (optimum 28–30 °C), pH 4–9 (optimum pH 6–7) and 0–3 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum 0–1 %).
DNA and tyrosine are hydrolysed, Tween 80 is weakly hydrolysed, but casein, chitin, CM-cellulose, pectin, starch and xanthine are not.
Weakly positive for β-galactosidase, but negative for indole production, glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase, urease, aesculin hydrolysis and gelatin hydrolysis (API 20NE).

In addition to the data shown in Table 1, sodium acetate, l-serine and 3-hydroxybutyric acid are assimilated, but l-rhamnose, d-ribose, inositol, sucrose, itaconic acid, suberic acid, sodium malonate, lactic acid, l-alanine, potassium 5-ketogluconate, glycogen, 3-hydroxybenzoic acid, salicin, melibiose, l-fucose, d-sorbitol, propionic acid, valeric acid, l-histidine, potassium 2-ketogluconate, 4-hydroxybenzoic acid and l-proline are not (API ID 32 GN).
Major fatty acids (>5 %) are iso-C16 : 0, iso-C17 : 1ω9c, iso-C15 : 0, summed feature 3 (iso-C15 : 0 2-OH and/or C16 : 1ω7c), iso-C11 : 0 3-OH and iso-C17 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 64.0 mol%.
The type strain, JS14-6T (=KACC 12748T =JCM 15424T), was isolated from soil cultivated with Citrus species on Jeju island, Republic of Korea.
